identified-content.person: HARPER, MEREDITH CLAIRE (MEREDITH CLAIRE HARPER BONHAM)

block.p: Meredith Claire Harper, a daughter of Sue Claire Colleton of Madison, N.J., and David E. Harper of Frenchtown, N.J., was married yesterday to Jay Benjamin Bonham, a son of James P. Bonham of Omaha and the late Barbara B. Bonham. The Rev. Jeffrey H. McArn, a Presbyterian minister and the Hamilton College chaplain, performed the ceremony at the school's chapel in Clinton, N.Y.

Mrs. Harper Bonham, 26, is an assistant dean of admissions at Hamilton College, where Mr. Bonham, 26, is an associate dean of admissions. She graduated cum laude from Kenyon College, and in September she is to begin a master's degree program in administration, planning and social policy at Harvard University's Graduate School of Education.

Mrs. Harper Bonham, 26, is an assistant dean of admissions at Hamilton College, where Mr. Bonham, 26, is an associate dean of admissions. She graduated cum laude from Kenyon College, and in September she is to begin a master's degree program in administration, planning and social policy at Harvard University's Graduate School of Education.

The bride's father is a senior vice president in Frenchtown for American Funds Distributors, a mutual funds company. Her mother, a nurse, is a coordinator at Paragon Rehabilitation in Morris Plains, N.J. The bride is a stepdaughter of Thomas E. Colleton and Vivien Harper.
The bridegroom graduated from Hamilton. His father is a vice president of the First National Bank of Omaha. The bridegroom is a stepson of Ann Bonham.
